name: CAPI 1.71.0
body:
**Highlights**

- CAPI now defaults to using BPM instead of monit directly for running jobs. To continue with the former behavior, set the `bpm.enabled` property to `false`.
- The Cloud Controller has upgraded to Rails 5, Sinatra 2 and Rack 2.

**CC API Version: 2.125.0 and [3.60.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.60.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.14](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.14/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/988c69d17f23baa09423a65775f608c47dc3d95c)
- BOSH spec incorrectly recommends that the cloud_controller_clock job be scaled to a single instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160940243)
- Document in the nfs_mounter job that it doesn't use bpm intentionally [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160966084)
- Operator can colocate webdav VM with jobs that scale, for non-prod environments [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151611314)
- Operator can see that cc_deployment_updater is not updating the database during a BBR operation [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160806907)
- capi release defaults to use bpm [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160864383)
- use bpm for rotate_cc_database_key errand [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160864517)


### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/adc4dd522359d3d69ec7d2dbbdf206909751a1f0)

- API client can cancel a deployment that has pre-empted an in-flight deployment. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160208638)
- Add tests for updating brokers once multi-service-registration exists [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160964169)
- As a developer, I can see CC API doc for the `service_instance_sharing ` flag [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160885365)
- As a developer, I can see CC API docs for the `hide_marketplace_from_unauthenticated_users` flag [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160827413)
- As a developer, I can see the name of the service broker providing each service when fetching services resources [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159951358)
- As an admin, I can register the same broker twice with different names [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159950844)
- As an admin, I cannot register a broker that has duplicate information in its catalog [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159950846)
- As an admin, when I query service usage events, I can see the broker's name and GUID [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159951293)
- As an authenticated user without read-access to a binding's space, I receive a 403 when fetching service binding parameters [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154809864)
- Processes that are rolling should be discoverable from the deployment resource [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159910933)
- Upgrade to Rails 5/Sinatra 2/Rack 2 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136075599)
- batch CC database queries for copilot sync [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/161293119)
- Fix cc-route-syncer random failure [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160866520)
- cloud_controller_clock job should not fail to sync apps and tasks when it gets into unrecoverable states  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156029607)


#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations

- [20180921102908_remove_uniqueness_on_index_broker_url_from_service_brokers.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/adc4dd522359d3d69ec7d2dbbdf206909751a1f0/db/migrations/20180921102908_remove_uniqueness_on_index_broker_url_from_service_brokers.rb)

- [20180924142407_remove_uniqueness_on_index_unique_id_from_service_plans.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/adc4dd522359d3d69ec7d2dbbdf206909751a1f0/db/migrations/20180924142407_remove_uniqueness_on_index_unique_id_from_service_plans.rb)
- [20180925150440_remove_services_label_provider_index.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/adc4dd522359d3d69ec7d2dbbdf206909751a1f0/db/migrations/20180925150440_remove_services_label_provider_index.rb)
- [20180927105539_add_broker_name_and_guid_to_service_usage_event.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/adc4dd522359d3d69ec7d2dbbdf206909751a1f0/db/migrations/20180927105539_add_broker_name_and_guid_to_service_usage_event.rb)

- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1227: Check for nil entries in bulk sync call [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160975841)

- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1239: Document 'hide marketplace' and 'service instance sharing' feature flags [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/161341145)

name: CAPI 1.70.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Resolves issue with db encryption key rotating data that was historically valid, but is not any longer
- Resolves issue with memory leaking when requesting GET /v2/spaces/:guid/summary

**CC API Version: 2.124.0 and [3.59.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.59.0/)**

name: CAPI 1.69.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Add checks to ensure database encryption key rotation occurs safely

**CC API Version: 2.123.0 and [3.58.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.58.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.14](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.14/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/2173ae25238f4d47c36fbd01bbba6b5b2517bd47)
- Operator can skip encryption key validation so they can avoid undeployable state [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160469213)
- Operator is prevented from deleting in-use database encryption key from cc.database_encryption.keys [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160206276)
- Operator is prevented from deleting in-use database encryption key from cc.db_encryption_key [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159024434)
- operator should not be allowed to set current_key_label to an undefined label [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160458378)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/2223f8806cbdef323421876c33c6aa53d3670200)
- API client can create a deployment while another deployment for that app is already in flight [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156674116)
- As a Service Broker, if I return a ConcurrencyError on provision/bind, then CF does not perform orphan mitigation [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159889473)
- Operator can't change value of an existing database encryption key [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160264933)
- Operator is prevented from deleting in-use database encryption key from cc.database_encryption.keys [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160206276)
- Operator is prevented from deleting in-use database encryption key from cc.db_encryption_key [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159024434)

name: CAPI 1.68.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Resolve issue that causes buildpacks with the same name, but different stacks fail to install 

**CC API Version: 2.122.0 and [3.57.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.57.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.14](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.14/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/1f2c874a18c62fe86ee8b4a5d1bfcbddbb6281ba)
- As a CF operator, I expect each tps-watcher instance to be able to reclaim its locket lock if it unexpectedly crashes without releasing the lock [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148798425)
- Remove unused template from capi-release [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160025345)
- Upgrade bundler in capi-release to 1.16.x [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159047505)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/018b31d172167b7e525aa17a1e1d9565f9c0d11d)
- API client can cancel a deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156674159)
- API client can filter deployments by state [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156626693)
- API client can specify a droplet when creating a deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156666909)
- API client receives meaningful error if app does not have a current droplet when creating a deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157098510)
- Add deployments link to /v3 endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159941158)
- As a developer, I can see the OSBAPI version CF supports using the `/v2/info` endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160233225)
- CC can use log cache to retrieve container metrics for apps with > 1000 instances [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159838932)
- DB Encryption Key Rotator does not properly rotate rows with `NULL` encryption key labels [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160297051)
- Deadlock error when creating two buildpacks simultaneously  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149010947)
- Race condition during buildpack upload can cause buildpack uploading to fail  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159749341)
- Scaling memory through apply-manifest restarts app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156513467)

#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations

- [20180904210247_add_index_to_deployments_on_state.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/018b31d172167b7e525aa17a1e1d9565f9c0d11d/db/migrations/20180904210247_add_index_to_deployments_on_state.rb)

name: CAPI 1.67.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Provide bosh links for internal API consumers
- Spaces can be filtered by guid

**CC API Version: 2.121.0 and [3.56.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.56.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.14](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.14/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/7643ce9f678eb8451c56e7248658050063cc1991)
- Capi release no longer includes debian_nfs_server job or package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156961670)
- Operator can consume a link to connect to CC mtls endpoint. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159800996)
- Operator can consume a link to connect to CC https endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159801000)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/4c9859099450bb29d63cf5d1c4a6332b0beb7a5c)
- API client can filter spaces by space guid [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159703345)
- API client can see that `buildpack` field is deprecated in favor of `buildpacks` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157613817)
- Add deployments link to /v3 endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159941158)
- As a CF developer, I can delete an app using the recursive=true flag and see that service bindings are deleted asynchronously  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158422116)
- As a broker author, if I return an HTTP 408, then CC does not perform orphan mitigation [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159459070)
- As a developer, I see an error if I try to delete a service instance which has an async service binding operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358107)
- As a developer, I see an error if I try to update a service instance which has an async service binding operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358090)
- As an admin, I can delete a space and see that it triggers one or more asynchronous binding deletes [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157879136)
- CC Client can see placement errors (details) in process stats [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159837586)
- CC uses log cache to respond to stats requests instead of the legacy traffic controller endpoint. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159042437)
- Pushing a Docker app with a long password fails when CCDB is MySQL [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159373079)
- Support new "`/packages` with resources json" in v2 API, i.e. when **CC** talks to Bits-Service [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158942266)
- a **capi client** can configure a weight for a route mapped to an application and see **requests to the route** are being load balanced across applications in proportion to the weights assigned to them  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158810175)
- a **capi** client can configure a weight for a route mapped to an application and see in the response body that a weight is associated with the mapping [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158470041)

#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations

- [20180813181554_add_route_weight_to_route_mappings.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/4c9859099450bb29d63cf5d1c4a6332b0beb7a5c/db/migrations/20180813181554_add_route_weight_to_route_mappings.rb)
- [20180814184641_change_encrypted_docker_password_on_droplets.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/4c9859099450bb29d63cf5d1c4a6332b0beb7a5c/db/migrations/20180814184641_change_encrypted_docker_password_on_droplets.rb)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1202: Don't orphan mitigate 408 responses [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159731068)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1206: Raise binding operation in progress error on service instance update [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160055348)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1207: Remove duplicate errors when deleting service instance bindings [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/160094167)

name: CAPI 1.65.0
body:
# Investigating a potential regression

**Highlights**
- Support for Open Service Broker API 2.14
- Service instance sharing is GA
- Resolve [issue](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/issues/1196) that causes some apps to go into a crashing state following a deployment. 

**CC API Version: 2.119.0 and [3.54.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.54.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.14](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.14/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/75b5ea3f8c139a0515b428dde439e9c3297335b9)
- Operator can configure capi-release to perform BBR operations using TLS when speaking to the database [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159289683)
- rotate_cc_database_key errand fails when CC->DB TLS is enabled [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159537236)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/a1356f421be9c31983d263f4cb42efe57c0ebb45)
- Documentation Service instance shared_to should contain space_guid [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159100711)
- API client can understand how a command is applied to a process now that manifest can provide one [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157756113)
- API client observes that the duration of an app deployment does not change when other deployments happen concurrently [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157984459)
- As a CF developer, I can delete a service binding using the recursive=true flag on the service instance delete endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157879138)
- As a CF developer, I can unshare a service instance and see that service bindings are deleted asynchronously [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158766483)
- As a developer, I can delete a service binding asynchronously and see that the binding is deleted [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358309)
- As a developer, I can delete a service binding asynchronously and see the binding information in the response [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158028194)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that an unbind operation has failed/timed out [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358314)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that there is a delete operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358316)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding delete request with accepts_incomplete=false and receive a 422 Not Supported [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357708)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding delete request with accepts_incomplete=true and receive a 202 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357580)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding delete request with accepts_incomplete=true and receive a 204 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155462928)
- As a developer, if I try to delete a service binding with accepts_incomplete=false and the broker starts an asynchronous operation, I see a warning [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158106722)
- As a service author, when I return an invalid binding after an asynchronous bind, I do not receive an automatic unbind request  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158873014)
- As a service author, when I return an invalid binding, an asynchronous unbind request is automatically sent to the broker [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158791422)
- As an admin, I see an error if I try to delete a space that has a binding operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157252907)
- Brokers returning 410 to last_operation during create binding operations should be considered invalid and CC should continue polling [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158939993)
- CC documentation show accepts_incomplete for deleting a service binding as an experimental feature [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156802721)
- CC supports OSBAPI v2.14 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159199167)
- Fix CC->DB TLS when using MySQL [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159509302)
- List all service bindings for unknown service instance returns 500 instead of 404 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158914498)
- Support new "`/packages` with resources json" in v2 API, i.e. when **CC** talks to Bits-Service [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158942266)

#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations

- [20180726120275_clear_process_command_for_buildpacks.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/a1356f421be9c31983d263f4cb42efe57c0ebb45/db/migrations/20180726120275_clear_process_command_for_buildpacks.rb)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1184: Extend cp_to_blobstore with resources param [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159284763)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1185: Users can delete service bindings asynchronously [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159293589)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1187: Listing all service bindings for unknown service instance returns 500 instead of 404 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159301027)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1192: Fix flaky test in service instance delete action [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159396267)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1195: Add missing fields to shared service docs examples [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159435046)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1199: CC should continue polling last_operation on 410 from the broker in case of binding create [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159524788)

name: CAPI 1.63.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Return current isolation segment when viewing process stats
- Seed internal domains via manifest

**Known Issues**
- There is an [issue](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/issues/1196) that causes some apps to go into a crashing state following a deployment. Those apps can be brought back up with a restart. Apps that would be affected are apps that are not regularly deployed.
- When configured to make TLS connections to MySQL databases cloud controller ignores the configuration and makes a non-TLS connection.

**CC API Version: 2.117.0 and [3.52.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.52.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/2bd1fbd85a83304791e4954d8120364f83348e83)
- CC API Route Registrar Healthcheck Script should have a longer timeout [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158990935)
- capi-release can't build with bosh `5.0.1` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159184599)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/3f0b15c75896ab965eed286f21776be8fa0668a0)
- /v3/processes/:guid/stats returns the compute isolation segment it is scheduled on [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138877383)
- 500 error on /v3/processes/GUID/stats when logged out  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158699580)
- Add bits-service-client ResourcePool#signed_matches_url method [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158942220)
- Brokers returning 410 to last_operation during create instance operations should be considered invalid and CC should continue polling https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/pull/1174 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157664157)
- Cloud Controller running in BPM can use a mounted NFS share as its blobstore [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157880726)
- Internal Domains are automatically seeded based on bosh property [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158961798)
- JSON schema for broker responses does not tolerate null values [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159172375)
- Operator can configure the deployer component for HA [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158367668)
- Subjects with **task.read** for a space can read any task in the space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159117944)
- Subjects with **task.read** for an org can read any task in the org [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159117946)

#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations
None

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1175: Pass credentials to bits-service-client ResourcePool, bump major version [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158989521)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1183: Broker dashboard_url's can be null [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/159214588)

name: CAPI 1.62.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Added ability to rotate database encryption key

**Known Issues**
- There is an [issue](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/issues/1196) that causes some apps to go into a crashing state following a deployment. Those apps can be brought back up with a restart. Apps that would be affected are apps that are not regularly deployed.
- When configured to make TLS connections to MySQL databases cloud controller ignores the configuration and makes a non-TLS connection.

**CC API Version: 2.116.0 and [3.51.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.51.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/bb167c4130899c23e5ddaa871f1da6eb5d3613fd)
- CC can mount nfs from a xenial stemcell [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158203210)

- The  'cc.temporary_create_internal_domain' does not exist [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154789194)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/b307952683ef54e4d52bda1d608d82b5d0e0e8f3)
- 500 when updating processes with null memory [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158809707)
- API client can observe that a deployment has completed [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156736752)
- API client observes that non-web processes are updated by a deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158223544)
- API user with space.create permission can create a space using POST /v2/spaces [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158437741)
- As a developer, if I try to create a service binding with accepts_incomplete=false and the broker starts an asynchronous operation, I see an error [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158106741)
- Docs for fetching a route binding parameter do not show experimental  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158457512)
- Operator can observe a metric for the number of DEPLOYING deployments [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157984444)
- Operator can update existing CCDB data to be encrypted by a new encryption key. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157206210)
- Special characters in database passwords: 2018 edition [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155608793)
- Stop using URI.encode/escape/decode/unescape [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151828473)
- Work out why CC gets a GOAWAY from the Perm server when talking to it for the first time in a while [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157681842)

#### Cloud Controller Database Migrations

- [20180628223056_rename_webish_process_guid_on_deployments.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/b307952683ef54e4d52bda1d608d82b5d0e0e8f3/db/migrations/20180628223056_rename_webish_process_guid_on_deployments.rb)
- [20180703233121_set_missing_fields_for_backfilled_web_processes.rb](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/blob/b307952683ef54e4d52bda1d608d82b5d0e0e8f3/db/migrations/20180703233121_set_missing_fields_for_backfilled_web_processes.rb)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1171: Mark route binding parameters as experimental [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158821592)
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #87: cloud_controller_api_health_check is flakey [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157404037)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1013: `pre-start` script in `nfs_server` job can take a long time [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153199815)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1141: Error when using docker registry password longer than 1000 chars (for example Amazon Elasstic Container Registry tokens) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157592841)
- cloudfoundry/tps #13: tps crash request to include crashed cell id [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158480048)

name: CAPI 1.61.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Introduce support for internal domains that can be used for app service discovery
- Include diego cell id in app crash events
- Resolve issue causing slow deployment times for foundations using webdav with many blobs
- Resolve issue preventing route services from being bound to apps
- Resolve issue preventing viewing of users in suspended orgs

**CC API Version: 2.115.0 and [3.50.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.50.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/624ac6228ec823a94aa242f514cefa215bba2102)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/33c104729d77d5fd36b8bd7dd02be35be292afa9)
- API client can know that audit events are created as a result of applying a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157646274)
- API client should NOT get an error when binding a route service to an app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158398455)
- Add documentation for buildpack stack [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157263047)
- An operator can delete an internal shared domain through a CC API call [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158046874)
- An operator, I can update the broker poll interval while an async binding job is enqueued [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156311174)
- As a CF app developer, I expect to see the Diego cell ID in the app crash event metadata so that I can more easily report the cell on which an app instance crashed [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155871993)
- As a dev, I do not see a warning when I do not provide configuration params when creating a service binding for a user-provided service instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158250648)
- As a developer, I see an error if I try to fetch service binding parameters whilst an asynchronous binding is in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158073118)
- As a service author, I can return a new dashboard URL when updating a service instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157601813)
- CF API docs for routes are updated for internal routes [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156213384)
- CNI wrapper writes ports to container metadata file [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158018684)
- Remove the requirement for web process guids to match app guids [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158480203)
- Shared domains include a field to show a domain is internal [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158046755)
- Spaces access class should integrate with Perm [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158221394)
- The  'cc.temporary_create_internal_domain' does not exist [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154789194)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1141: Error when using docker registry password longer than 1000 chars (for example Amazon Elasstic Container Registry tokens) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157592841)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1147: add fog-aliyun for cloud foundry deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157926543)

name: CAPI 1.60.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Packages support resource matching

**Known Issues**
- Route services cannot be bound to apps

**CC API Version: 2.114.0 and [3.49.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.49.0/)**

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/bf90d74e4d1c7becbbadff16cd8e9b88a56fdf28)
- API client can retrieve audit event for applying a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154984642)
- API client can see that after creating a deployment, their app eventually converges on a new process [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156626958)
- API client can take advantage of matched resources when uploading to v3 packages [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157671003)
- Add documentation for buildpack stack [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157263047)
- An operator can create an internal shared domain through a CC API call [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158046636)
- As a PWS operator I can see Perm experiment statistics to help find bugs and roles which haven't been migrated [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153261444)
- Attempting to bind a route service to an app results in an unknown error on both the API and manifests [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/158130575)
- Bits-Service client uses new app_stash endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157623194)
- Container metrics do not display for non-web V3 processes [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157446374)
- Do not allow broker registration that contains basic auth credentials in the URL [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155659461)
- Improve performance of /v3/packages [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157236006)
- Permist can observe CRUD attempts for '/v2/organizations'  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157579163)
- Permist can observe list attempts for '/v2/organizations' [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157579164)
- Rewrite the /v3/organizations endpoint in CAPI to make calls to perm instead [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157323267)
- Rewrite the /v3/spaces endpoint in CAPI to make calls to perm instead [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157323456)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1110: Do not allow Service Broker registration with basic auth in the broker_url [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155849661)

name: CAPI 1.58.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Buildpacks can be associated to a specific stack
- Rolled azure fog client back, to prevent slow push times
- Experimental support of asynchronous service bindings

**CC API Version: 2.112.0 and [3.47.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.47.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/970d70b11b632f0d72f96bbe5c231a16c80739d4)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/7b858726386173b2c01a47df1e21d79751a0f414)
- API client can find docs for include parameter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157017978)
- API client can retrieve current manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154816312)
- API client can see that creating a deployment results in multiple web-ish processes for the associated app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156626905)
- API client can view json example next to object definitions in v3 docs [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150315104)
- API client connection does not hang when UAA is unavailable [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152565859)
- API client receives useful error when setting buildpack properties on a docker app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156663500)
- API client sees that origin field is not experimental in docs and old remove endpoints are deprecated [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150149396)
- API client should be able to specify 'null' for buildpack in their manifest to autodetect the buildpack for their app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157404776)
- API client should not see incorrect field name for buildpack errors [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156102427)
- API client should receive the same error creating a build when the package does not exist or client lacks access to the package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157099080)
- API client should see meaningful error when trying to map a route for a non-existing domain using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157016079)
- Add index to `state` on packages [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157266200)
- As a CC user, I am able to associate buildpacks with stacks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153256959)
- As a CF app developer, I expect the instance-identity credentials certificate also to include the org and space guids so that I can use them to satisfy broader CF authorization predicates [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154533193)
- As a developer, I can asynchronously bind a syslog_drain_url binding [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156465058)
- As a developer, I can asynchronously bind a volume_mounts binding [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157430341)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that a create operation failed because the broker did not return a valid binding [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155358267)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that a create operation has failed/timed out [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357877)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that a create operation has succeeded [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357926)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding and see that there is a create operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357843)
- As a developer, I can fetch a service binding that has been created synchronously and see that the create operation completed successfully [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357777)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding create request with accepts_incomplete=false and receive a 422 Not Supported [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357660)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding create request with accepts_incomplete=true and receive a 201 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155462559)
- As a developer, I can make a service binding create request with accepts_incomplete=true and receive a 202 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357547)
- As a developer, I see an error if I try to create a service binding which has a create operation in progress [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155357983)
- As a developer, I see an error if I try to delete a service binding which has a create operation in progress  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157046695)
- CC documentation show accepts_incomplete for service binding as an experimental feature [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156729937)
- Fetch service instance/bindings returns string keyed hashes instead of symbols [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156164320)
- Investigate azure blobstore issues [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157577866)
- Move database calls out of PaginatedListPresenter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157223816)
- Operator can disable deployment resources [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156736765)
- Repeated requests to v3 endpoints result in too many open statsd connections (and thus failed requests and/or crashed CCs) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157524029)
- Threads that are killed when an error occurs during sync may not release their db connection [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156029420)
- UAA connection timeout is configurable and has a relaxed default [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157702069)
- We should log an audit event for async operations even if user is deleted [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157559523)


#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1064: Add stack association to buildpack model [#153256959] [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154527662)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1133: postgres detects deadlock during DB migration in pre_start [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/157279663)

name: CAPI 1.57.0
body: Please do not use this release. It contains an issue that causes most attempts to assign or unassign a user to a space or organization to timeout on environments that receive "prod-like" traffic.

name: CAPI 1.56.0
body: Please do not use this release. It contains an issue that causes API instances to crash periodically.

name: CAPI 1.54.0
body:
**Important**

This release removes the ability to configure temporary flags used to opt into secure CC and Diego communication.  Prior to deploying this release, ensure [these instructions](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pdxC1DqROqk72BDw--6b5v2r0K7Jpp9l-FbO6tlkQDs/edit) have been completed, otherwise API downtime will occur.

As part of this work, we have removed the following components from `capi-release`
- stager
- nsync
- tps listener

**Highlights**
- Per invocation timeouts for http and port health checks are configurable on processes
- The experimental feature -- server side manifests -- has parity with cli manifests
- Fixed an issue causing duplicate app usage events for `STOPPED` and `STAGING_STOPPED`
- Bumped cloud controller dependencies

**Notable bumped dependencies**
- fog-aws (1.4.1 -> 2.0.1)
- fog-google (1.2.0 -> 1.3.3)
- fog-local (0.3.1 -> 0.5.0)
- pg (0.19.0 -> 1.0.0)
- mariadb_connector_c (2.3.0 -> 2.3.5)
- nginx (1.13.4 -> 1.13.12)

**CC API Version: 2.108.0 and [3.43.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.43.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/171d051d2246fc757127a084e3612c72a952fba1)
- Operator can no longer configure temporary bridge tls properties [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156054103)
- Operator can no longer deploy deprecated bridge components in capi-release [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156054338)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/38ce056e3f27a8df7361c68ecc7c214a3babe008)
-  API client can view all buildpacks used to stage a droplet  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150068339)
- API client can configure per invocation timeout for http health checks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156819169)
- API client can configure per invocation timeout for port health checks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156819033)
- API client can include space in an app response  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155087566)
- API client can set  environment variables using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154745470)
- API client can set health check endpoint using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154747368)
- API client can set health check timeout using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154747271)
- API client can set health check type using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154746951)
- API client can set no-route using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154816070)
- API client can set random-route using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154816028)
- API client can set routes using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154814328)
- API client can set service bindings using a manifest [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154813564)
- API client sees that the 'name' parameter is not experimental in the api docs for service bindings [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152622195)
- As a dev, I see a warning when providing configuration params when creating a service binding for a user-provided service instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154667172)
- Duplicate STOPPED and STAGING_STOPPED App Usage Events [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156143860)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1120: Add documentation of undocumented query [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156403543)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1050: Add retry logic when assigning a random port [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/154007745)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1107: 500 Unknown error on /v2/spaces/GUID/summary while apps are being deleted [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155775225)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1119: Undocumented query parameter for 'GET /v2/organizations/:guid/user_roles' [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156215378)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1120: Add documentation of undocumented query [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156403543)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #1124: Parallel DELETE /v2/apps/guid on same app result in 204/500 instead of 204/404 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/156659645)

name: CAPI 1.51.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Add configuration for Sequel timeouts to tune for environments with unreliable networks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/155407878)

**CC API Version: 2.105.0 and [3.40.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.40.0/)**

name: CAPI 1.47.0
body:
# Important

There is an [issue](https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=89174) with MySQL 5.5 that can cause application downtime when deploying this release. Other databases and versions are not affected by application downtime, but may have other issues.  

|Database|Issue|
-|-
MySQL 5.5 and earlier, MariaDB using InnoDB 5.5 | Application downtime.
MySQL 5.6 or later, MariaDB using InnoDB/XtraDb 5.6 | No issues.
PostgresSQL | **No** application downtime. In rare cases a deploy may fail, but succeed on a subsequent attempt. If subsequent attempts fail, follow the mitigation plan below.

## Mitigation Plan

### Mitigation for cf-release
There is a `cloud_controller_clock` job running on each of the `clock_z*` instances.
If the only jobs on a clock instance are `cloud_controller_clock`, `metron_agent`, `consul_agent`,
and `system_localhost`, you can stop the entire instance with this command:

`bosh stop -d DEPLOYMENT_NAME clock_z1`

Repeat for each `clock_z*` instance.

Otherwise, for each clock instance i, do the following:,

```
bosh ssh -d DEPLOYMENT_NAME clock_z[i]
sudo
monit stop cloud_controller_clock
```

After the upgrade deployment has completed, bosh vms should report that all
`clock_*` instances are running. If any aren't, bosh ssh to each non-running
`clock_*` instance, `sudo`, and run `monit start cloud_controller_clock`.

### Mitigation for cf-deployment
There is a `cloud_controller_clock` job on each of the `scheduler` instances. Unlike
for cf-release, there is only one option. The `cloud_controller_clock` job should be explicitly stopped
on each node as follows:

```
bosh ssh -d DEPLOYMENT_NAME scheduler/i
sudo
monit stop cloud_controller_clock
```

After the upgrade deployment has completed, bosh vms should report that all
`scheduler` instances are running. If any aren't, `bosh ssh` to each non-running
`scheduler` instance, `sudo`, and run `monit start cloud_controller_clock`.

# Notes

**Highlights**
- Resolves an issue that causes tasks to sometimes be canceled prematurely or marked as failed after completing successfully.

**CC API Version: 2.101.0 and [3.36.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.36.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/50e96e2eeedaedb865099a87fee30508c0a86265)
- As an operator I can take a backup of only the relevant parts of the cc blobstore [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152718388)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/c9e54f391005d3871e3b0c697ab03d40ca354e39)
- A Cloud Foundry administrator should see a log when there is a discrepancy between Perm and CC [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153616329)
- As an app dev (receiver), I can continue to bind apps to a service instance that has been shared with me when the feature flag is disabled [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153438338)
- As an app dev (sharer), I can unshare a service instance from a space where I do not have access [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153244755)
- As an app dev (sharer), I cannot rename a service instance that has been shared [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152109574)
- As an app dev (sharer), I cannot share a service instance that is using an inactive plan [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150801609)
- As an app dev (sharer), if I try to share a service instance into a space where access to that service is not enabled, the share fails [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150801606)
- As an app dev (sharer), if the service instance sharing feature flag is disable, I should still be able to unshare existing shares [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150970623)
- As an app dev I can filter v3 service instances by space guid [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152922808)
- As an app dev, I can only see bindings in spaces that I have access to for shared service instances [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153456495)
- Cloud Controller should check to see if a user can perform an action with Perm (V3) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152564770)
- Improve performance of GET /v2/service_instances [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152736102)
- Permission denied while trying to V3 copy a droplet with NFS blobstore [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153418863)
- Service instance sharing-related errors should usually return 422 instead of 400 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153176525)
- V3 droplet/package/other blobstore resources downloads  don't work when using an NFS server [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153418205)
- change tld to apps.internal [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152251321)

#### Pull Requests and Issues

name: CAPI 1.46.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Default to secure communication between Cloud Controller and Diego. See [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pdxC1DqROqk72BDw--6b5v2r0K7Jpp9l-FbO6tlkQDs/edit?usp=sharing) for more details.
- Resolves thread leak with diego synchronization.
- Resolves issue causing periodic cleanup jobs to stop running.
- Introduce experimental support for named service bindings.

**Job Spec Changes**
- Removed `cc.users_can_select_backend` property. Diego is the only supported backend, so this property is no longer relevant.

**Known Issues**
- Tasks are sometimes canceled prematurely or marked as failed after completing successfully. Resolved in [capi-release 1.47.0](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/releases/tag/1.47.0)

**CC API Version: 2.100.0 and [3.35.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.35.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/5534906e48bd4a2465d0beef8daa7f23be6b8e89)
- Add `set -o pipefail` to the bbr scripts along with `set -e` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152908493)
- As a CF operator, I expect the BBS eventually to exit when its backing Postgres database is unavailable [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150719472)
- As a CF operator, if I configure the stager with a whitelist of insecure docker registries, I expect the docker app lifecycle builder to allow insecure communication with those registries (regression)4 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152056684)
- Operator sees that local bridge is used by default. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152623585)
- Potential drain failure on tps_watcher drain script [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152727121)
- monit_stop_job shouldn't try to run if monit_unmonitor_job is still running in pre-backup-lock script [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152727591)
- wait_unmonitor_job's regex is not strict enough [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153100741)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/dd54fc52174677489b1a976461b54a19821eab32)
- API client can filter service bindings by name [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144045265)

- API client gets actionable error message when starting an app without a droplet [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152646058)
- API client observes a audit.app.restart audit event [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152335520)
- API client with a role that allows service instance read can view dashboard url [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152654202)
- As a CAPI developer, when I create an org or space with the V3 API, corresponding roles should be created in Perm [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151260765)
- As an API client I can discover the /v3/service_instances resource [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152726367)
- As an app dev (receiver), I can see information regarding service instances that have been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152035378)
- As an app dev (receiver), I can see minimal space information in the shared_from endpoint when a service instance has been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152540454)
- As an app dev (receiver), I can see sharing information regarding service instances that have been shared with me (shared_from) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150973038)
- As an app dev (receiver), I cannot delete a service instance that has been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150973376)
- As an app dev (receiver), I cannot rename a service instance to the same name of a service instance that has been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152593218)
- As an app dev (receiver), I cannot share a service instance that has been shared with me where I do not have access to the service instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151441010)
- As an app dev (receiver), I cannot update a service instance that has been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150973390)
- As an app dev (receiver), I shouldn't be able to create a service instance with the same name as an instance that has been shared with me [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152314627)
- As an app dev (sharer), I can see sharing information regarding service instances that I have shared (shared_to) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151432798)
- As an app dev (sharer), I can see the number of bindings made to service instances that I have shared [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151432730)
- As an app dev (sharer), I cannot delete a service instance that I have shared which does not have bindings in another space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152470931)

- As an app dev (sharer), if I try to share a service instance into a space where a service instance exists with the same name, the share fails [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150801605)
- As an app dev,  I cannot create a service key for a service instance that I do not have access to (i.e. has been shared with me) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152592943)
- As an app dev,  I cannot list service keys for a service instance that I do not have access to (i.e. has been shared with me) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151950132)
- As an app dev, I can list non-shared service instances using the v3 API [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152073155)
- As an app dev, I can list shared service instances using the v3 API [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152344116)
- As an app dev, I cannot share a route service [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152036417)
- As an app dev, I cannot share user provided services [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151997784)
- As an app dev, I cannot view a specific service key or delete a service key for a service instance that I do not have access to (i.e. has been shared with me) [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152721273)
- Cloud Controller has a feature flag to enable the querying of perm [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152822891)
- Threads leak during errors in sync [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152771516)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #66: some clock_jobs never run if last_completed_at < last_started_at value [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152736136)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #942: `users_can_select_backend` defaults to true [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152096308)

- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #972: Implement bare-bones GET /v3/service_instances [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152481619)

name: CAPI 1.45.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Support multiple UAA origins when configuring user roles.

**Job Spec Changes**
- Breaking logging change with introduction of property `cc.log_db_queries` which defaults to `false` for jobs `cloud_controller_ng`, `cloud_controller_worker`, and `cloud_controller_clock`. This causes DB  logs to **not** be logged by default. If you want to see these logs then you'll need to switch this value to `true`.  An example of the logs in question:

```
{"timestamp":1510256720.2370548,"message":"(0.001166s) SELECT * FROM `delayed_jobs` WHERE ((((`run_at` <= '2017-11-09 19:45:20') AND (`locked_at` IS NULL)) OR (`locked_at` < '2017-11-09 15:45:20') OR (`locked_by` = 'cc_api_worker.api.0.2')) AND (`failed_at` IS NULL) AND (`queue` IN ('cc-api-0'))) ORDER BY `priority` ASC, `run_at` ASC LIMIT 5","log_level":"info","source":"cc.background","data":{},"thread_id":46994475118420,"fiber_id":46994498232380,"process_id":1759344,"file":"/var/vcap/packages/cloud_controller_ng/cloud_controller_ng/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.4.0/gems/sequel-4.49.0/lib/sequel/database/logging.rb","lineno":88,"method":"block in log_each"}
```



**CC API Version: 2.99.0 and [3.34.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.34.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/d5146b2d88a781dae70104c7c3286adf94436bbd)
- Operator should find valid defaults in BOSH job spec files [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/105338348)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/3052dc9fc0bbd0026eae090385b8ad1fba14f2c4)
- /v2/buildpacks pagination includes invalid order-by parameter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151234011)

#### Pull Requests and Issues

name: CAPI 1.44.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Improve [BOSH Backup and Restore](https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/bbr/) support
- Add experimental support for service brokers storing credentials in [CredHub](https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/credhub/)

**Job Spec Changes**
- `release_level_backup`: Now defaults to `true`
- `cc.credential_references.interpolate_service_bindings`: When set to `true`, does not interpolate CredHub references for staging and running apps and tasks.

**CC API Version: 2.98.0 and [3.33.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.33.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/dd7b235bcc25736f54bc3f8a959642250513c1dd)
- CAPI release 1.42 *sometimes* tries and fails to compile ruby-debug-ide [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151413496)
- BBR `release_level_backup` property is true by default for all capi-release jobs [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151621461)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/12ff0ce84071d728649134b018272fc0c656b249)
- API client can view the space relationship on an app resource [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148714789)
- V3 Droplets should not have a link to V2 Buildpack [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137560711)
- Remove `/internal/log_access/:guid` endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148924073)
- Bump nokogiri to 1.8.1 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151537688)
- API client can find credhub link at "/" endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150753534)
- App developer sees that service credentials from credhub are interpolated for staging [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151703613)
- App developer sees that service credentials from credhub are interpolated for running apps and tasks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151111975)
- Operator can configure CF to NOT interpolate service credentials from credhub [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150753513)
- API client can view service keys that are credhub references [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150753759)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #61: Add patch for nginx-http-upload-module [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151710576)
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #60: cloud_controller_ng pre-restore-lock exits before monit finished [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151686451)
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #58: un-namespace `release_level_backup` property [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151765180)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #864: 500 unknown error when binding route to app in org with quota of 0M app instance mem [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149874154)
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #63: cloud_controller_ng pre-backup-lock does not work when there is more than 1 CC instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151817365)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #897: App Staging buildpack cache not getting updated when using NFS Fog Local blobstore [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150864060)
  - Operators using NFS blobstores will need to `DELETE /v2/blobstores/buildpack_cache` to remove existing read-only cache files

name: CAPI 1.43.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Includes support for [BOSH Backup and Restore](https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/bbr/)
- Includes support for Open Service Broker API [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)
- Use Ruby 2.4.2
- Resolves issue that caused `properties.uaa.clients.cc-service-dashboards.secret` to become a required manifest property. It is now optional again.

**Job Spec Changes**
- `cloud_controller.release_level_backup`: Set to `true` to include cloud_controller jobs in backup and restore operations. Used by jobs `cloud_controller_ng`, `cloud_controller_clock`, `cloud_controller_worker`, `tps`, and `blobstore`.

**CC API Version: 2.97.0 and [3.32.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.32.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.13](https://github.com/openservicebrokerapi/servicebroker/blob/v2.13/spec.md)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/f96a1c4b07d8c55fb9d9955c128c472ed4bbdc92)
- As an operator I can enable blobstore backup in the CAPI release with a feature flag [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151209989)
- Upgrade to ruby 2.4.X [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143732511)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/901952357c1e1355f14e2154fa9d088f8ecb2dac)
- API client can view the space relationship on an app resource [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148714789)
- As a SBA I receive the most appropriate error when a schema has multiple errors [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149627143)
- As a SBA, I can register a JSON schema without the type field [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150877576)
- As a SBA, I cannot register a JSON schema without the $schema field [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150969868)
- As a service broker author, I can register a single plan with a service binding schema [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145580773)
- As a service broker author, I can register multiple plans with schemas [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145580793)
- As a service broker author, I can register multiple services with multiple plans with schemas [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145580795)
- As an operator, I can use bbr to take a consistent backup *and* restore of my cloud controller database [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149590307)
- As an operator, I can use scripts to backup *and* restore my cloud controller database [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149590309)
- Cloud Controller reports v2.13 OSBAPI to service brokers [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151221517)
- Deploy fails if previously optional properties `uaa.clients.cc-service-dashboards.secret` and `uaa.clients.cc_service_broker_client.secret` are not provided [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151448322)
- Improve spec description for cc logging level properties [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151529681)
- PM sees that credhub is a reserved system route [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150753518)
- Process's "command" property is sometimes null when process type is web [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150232594)
- Service Broker observes Cloud Controller client in bind request [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151111701)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #900: List UPS Routes documents invalid query parameter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151001946)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #908: Support Open Service Broker API v2.13 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151250898)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #912: Add network info to staging tasks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151529348)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #915: Add internal-routes to the route info. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151503029)

name: CAPI 1.42.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Resolves several issues when removing legacy bridge components.
  - Now compatible with NFS
  - Now works with service bindings that include volume services

**Job Spec Changes**

- `properties.uaa.clients.cc_service_key_client.secret`: This release introduces a new UAA client. Operators must provide a client secret. Any sufficiently strong password-like string will suffice.
- `properties.uaa.clients.cc-service-dashboards.secret`: capi-release 1.42.0 includes a regression that marked the previously optional properties.uaa.clients.cc-service-dashboards.secret property as required. Temporarily set this property to any strong password if you haven't already provided a value. The next capi-release will again mark this property as optional.

**CC API Version: 2.96.0 and [3.31.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.31.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.12](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/94bb820b75ec57ee30a27a0b33a31aef865ce620)

- As a CTA I have documentation on the schema work in the CAPI documentation [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149957792)

- cf push with stack and instance_count fails. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151066738)

#### Pull Requests and Issues

name: CAPI 1.41.0
body: **Highlights** - Support for SSL connection to CCDB - Resolve an issue where the non-bridge syncing component was marking successfully completed tasks as FAILED - Always perform orphan blob cleanup **CC API Version: 2.95.0 and [3.30.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.30.0/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.12](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/4f7a6e942c2e7270b30fc5d586b8b46755c27291) - Bump locket-client to v1.1 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149823810) - Use BPM in capi-release [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150264913) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/b7674e074bbb09402e6d0e4f26e8289243cf1faa) - API client can view Features for an App [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150017420) - API client can view the SSH feature for an app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150018172) - API client should NOT see 'endpoint' field for non-http health check types [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149942433) - As an operator, I'd like to be able to configure my database connection to use SSL [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132950039) - Delayed job workers keep crashing with "Attempt to delete object did not result in a single row modification" [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150534480) - Include a droplets link in the call to /v3 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150370984) - Move off fork of delayed_jobs_sequel [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149930218) - Operator can find ASG guids on diego lrp and task egress rules [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150063448) - Operator can see that orphan blob cleanup is happening by default. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147556599) - Tasks failed by sync job should create TASK_STOPPED usage events [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150501300) - We should not fail tasks that are actually still running on Diego [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150532654) - v2 Put/Post apps doesn't accept empty buildpack parameters anymore [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150502954) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #888: Fix infinite loop bug when UAA returns empty key map [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150683900) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #871: Update v2.yml [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150160759) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #886: Execute bpm from /var/vcap/jobs/bpm/bin [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150697649) - cloudfoundry/capi-release #51: Bump ruby version [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150514173) - cloudfoundry/capi-release #52: Execute bpm from /var/vcap/jobs/bpm/bin [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150697683) # Job Spec Changes Cloud Controller can now be configured to communicate with its database using SSL. All three components must be configured: `cloud_controller_ng`, `cloud_controller_clock`, `cloud_controller_worker`. Each component takes the same new properties described below. - `ccdb.ca_cert` - The ca cert to use when communicating with the database over SSL - `ccdb.ssl_verify_hostname` - Verify that the database SSL certificate matches the host to which the connection is attempted - defaults to `true`

name: CAPI 1.40.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Some Cloud Foundry deployments may have `TASK_STARTED` usage events without corresponding `TASK_STOPPED` events, even though the task is completed or the app has been deleted. The bug that caused that was fixed in capi-release [1.36.0](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/releases/tag/1.36.0). This release will backfill missing `TASK_STOPPED` events to allow billing to complete the task lifecycle. Because we do not know when the task completed, we will record as if it ran for one second, to prevent over billing.

**CC API Version: 2.94.0 and [3.29.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.29.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.12](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/b4455bb5ddc24eef3998037e1e8c6becf1afe9cc)
- API client can view a specific organization [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143062281)

- API client should see better error message when updating user provided service instances using the managed service instance API [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145872931)
- Do a better job of improving the performance of add_missing_task_stopped_usage_events migration  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150232569)

- V2 -> V3 App model migration fails when duplicate route mappings exist [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150026272)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #853: mysql2 dependency is leaking file descriptors to /dev/null [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/149226769)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #849: /v2/events filtering by timestamp using ">" not working as expected [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/148715427)

name: CAPI 1.39.0
body: Please do not use this release. It contains a migration that can take very long to execute.

name: CAPI 1.38.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Introduce General Availability for several V3 resources
  - Apps
  - Processes
  - Packages
  - Builds
  - Droplets
  - Organizations
  - Spaces
  - Jobs
 

**CC API Version: 2.92.0 and [3.27.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.27.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.12](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/aff3862e27fdf8d3f4d99d5dbcea5e645112167e)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/d2dbae2838ec0aa8d8b26e8918d4036405177716)
- API client can observe a service binding delete audit event and determine which app and service the binding was for [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146101051)
