name: CAPI 1.31.0
body:
**Important**
- The way that resources are stored for resource matching has changed. Resource files are now stored in a subdirectory, named `app_bits_cache`, in the resource bucket . This means existing resource files will be orphaned.  This change is in preparation for automated orphan cleanup for Cloud Controller managed blobstores.  If storage space is a concern for a given environment, then operators should consider manually purging the resource bucket after this release is deployed.  Before purging the resource bucket, please ensure that resources are stored in a different bucket than all other resources (droplets, packages, buildpacks).

**Highlights**
- Introduces support for Service Broker API 2.12
- Resolves several issues when syncing LRPs and Tasks with Diego

**CC API Version: 2.85.0 and [3.20.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.20.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.12](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/13b17376cd84b4af6cbd601cb242e7661310f0c7)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/c11841b5675aaa47ccd2a70b742eb25601d26d2c)
- API Client can delete an app asynchronously  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136154453)
- API Client experiences improved performance of `GET /v3/app/<guid>/tasks` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/142737343)
- API client can discover how to allow all types and codes for ICMP security group rules. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146020929)
- API client can discover link for `/v3/processes` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146469509)
- API client can discover the logging api location [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146118193)
- API client should NOT receive error when canceling a task diego does not know about [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146314649)
- API client should follow a consistent schema to specify an *service-binding-to-app relationship* when creating a service binding [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141055189)
- API client should not be able to specify custom buildpacks for an app when platform has disabled custom buildpacks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146191015)
- API client should not be able to use custom buildpacks when the platform has disabled custom buildpacks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135569941)
- API client should see that next_url does NOT omit the organization_guid filter for /v2/routes [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/146036363)
- App developer should be able to specify HTTP Healthcheck for processes using the v3 api [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136507491)
- CC Sync job fails when app has shared domain with `router_group_guid` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147064255)
- Do not fail sync when there is a race condition creating LRPs [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147622805)
- With many processes, if the first one fails due to invalid LRP, freshness will still be bumped even if there is another error [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147129623)


#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cli #1096: `cf push` fails when file mode is invalid, but doesn't say which file was the cause [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141783543)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #821: When calling /v2/spaces/:spaceGuid/services, space-scoped services return an empty array for their service plans [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145290403)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #831: Misleading documentation for Resource Match API ? [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147186119)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #835: Support Open Service Broker API v2.12 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/147515447)

name: CAPI 1.30.0
body:
**Important**
- This release includes large, internal changes for handling staging. As a result, some staging tasks may fail during deployment when the cloud controller jobs are updating. 
- DEA is no longer supported as a backend runtime.

**Highlights**
- Introduce a `read` permission for service brokers to query when displaying dashboards for service instances.  Read [here](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/issues/792) for more.
- Fixes some issues regarding tasks erroneously failing or being stuck in a `RUNNING` state.
- Introduce Builds resource in the [V3 API](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/) to represent the staging process.

**CC API Version: 2.84.0 and [3.19.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.19.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/4b56eaf4acedf9310785e13141ad52de01e47604)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/b5491f42fe31d654f05c106496a850ebebe0c555)
- API client can discover the network-policy api location [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145787165)
- API client can observe STAGING_START and STAGING_STOP usage events based on builds [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143270247)
- API client can see that LANG environment variable is set for tasks  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144961599)
- API client should NOT receive errors when creating/deleting buildpacks concurrently [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143674115)
- API client should NOT see any fields related to builds on droplet [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141461443)
- API client should create droplet by POST /v3/builds instead of POST /v3/packages/:guid/droplets  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141362901)
- API client should see fields nested under result move to the top level on droplet [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141461745)
- API client should see that builds that do not finish staging are eventually marked failed [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143693647)
- As a platform, I can send a context parameter to brokers when creating a service instance [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144015647)
- Bit service can update package status and checksums [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143989565)
- Bump nokogiri to >= 1.7.2 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145477687)
- CF users should need `cloud_controller.read` scope rather than `cloud_controller.write` to view isolation segment for org an space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143193113)
- Cloud Controller double-counts memory (and disk?) against quota when updating a task [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145731927)
- Operator should observe that an interrupted sync job does not result in waiting 4 hours until bulking continues [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145569745)
- Sync job should continue to update LRPs, tasks, and bump freshness even if a LRP Update returns a `Error_InvalidRequest` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145361917)
- API Client should NOT see 500 error when GET /v2/organizations/:guid/users has an error communicating with UAA [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143518959)
- API client can discover from a build the user that created the resource [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144061995)
- API client can observe build create and droplet create audit events at the correct points in the staging lifecycle [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143270215)
- investigate route deduping issue for buildpack vs docker with legacy bridge [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/145768953)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #792: Service instance permissions should distinguish between read and write [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141794109)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #814: Organization Memory not properly calculated  [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144812935)

name: CAPI 1.27.0
body:
**CC API Version: 2.81.0 and [3.16.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.16.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### Job Spec Changes

#### `tps_watcher`
- New optional properties to enable migrating distributed locks off of consul. Additional details available [here](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/diego-release/blob/master/docs/migrating-from-consul-to-sql-locks.md).
  - `capi.tps.watcher.locket.api_location`
  - `capi.tps.watcher.skip_consul_lock`

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/2103e744192c7884f08fa8a35e2625c313f5cd07)
- New version(s) of nginx: 1.11.13 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143052673)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/c2d1816117913c5908c1bfcf69aae745b051ad4b)
- API client can copy a droplet to be consistent with Copy a Package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135569085)
- API client should NOT see that setting health check to process results in port health checks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144250153)
- As an API client, I can specify docker credentials on a v3 package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140458843)
- Deployments using nsync bulker should NOT be given task completion callbacks against /internal/v4/tasks/ [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144066541)
- V3 Apps running on Cloud Foundry can only use port 8080 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136375821)

### [TPS](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/tps/tree/ed3c272c483f9f0a4fc7b982ebeef5771c6c3878)
- PM should see that TPS Watcher does not have a dependency on Consul for locking [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143080755)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #527: Provide atomic way to delete an orphaned route [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/112675831)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #804: Task Containers incorrectly overwrite `DATABASE_URL` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/143449607)
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #809: Doc: `detected_buildpack_guid` is undocumented for Get Space Summary [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/144023195)

name: CAPI 1.26.0
body:
**Highlights**
- Resolved issue with /v2/events `next_url` containing an invalid next page

**CC API Version: 2.80.0 and [3.15.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.15.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### Job Spec Changes

#### `cc_uploader`
-  **Required properties** to enable diego to use mutual_tls for uploading assets to cloud controller. This ca cert should match the ca cert configured for the rep in the diego deployment. See this [doc](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/blob/1.26.0/docs/tls-configuration.md) for help generating certs.
    - `capi.cc_uploader.mutual_tls.ca_cert` 
    - `capi.cc_uploader.mutual_tls.server_cert`
    - `capi.cc_uploader.mutual_tls.server_key`

- Removed properties. These properties contained an IP address and port. The ip and port values have been moved into separate fields.
    - `capi.cc_uploader.listen_addr`
    - `capi.cc_uploader.debug_listen_addr`
    
- New properties
    - `internal_hostname`
    - `http_port`
    - `https_port`
    - `bind_addr`
    - `debug_bind_addr`

name: CAPI 1.25.0
body:
### Known Issues

- When the Routing API is enabled -- `properties.routing_api.enabled` -- failures may occur when performing asynchronous operations such as deleting an app. These errors apply to apps that are associated to routes that are associated to domains that are associated to router groups.
- Users that belong to any space containing a user provided service instance are unable to view any specific service plan: `/v2/service_plans/:guid`. Users are still able to view the marketplace and provision service instances.

**CC API Version: 2.79.0 and [3.14.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.14.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/64b73ed9a73614c0901e7aac91cd5d936fe83f1a)
- New version(s) of nginx: 1.11.11 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/142148795)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/a652dbf290205c7498f628f7cf06f5913aff63e4)
- API Client can filter spaces by organization guid [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141969393)
- API Client should see a 422 error when updating isolation segment names is an invalid operation [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141829527)
- API Client should see better error when assigning an invalid isolation segment to a space. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/142650421)
- API client can copy packages at /v3/packages instead of /v3/apps/:guid/packages [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140523763)
- API client can discover the build resource location to help construct urls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141451043)
- API client gets 422 when creating packages in a space they do not have permission to write to [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/142999347)
- API client should follow a consistent schema to specify the *current_droplet-to-app relationship* [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140529293)
- API client should no longer see `total_desired_instances` field for apps [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140527175)
- API client should see `checksum` field instead of `hash` field on droplets [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140530845)
- CC-Uploader: uploading buildpack cache happens over an endpoint using mtls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139996789)
- CC-Uploader: uploading droplets and polling happens over an endpoint using mtls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139996781)
- Canceling a task should NOT be impacted by the org or space quota [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141884665)
- Droplet Download URL should use Mutual TLS [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137411519)
- Querying apps when app is being deleted results in 500 internal server error [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140964377)
- http droplet download url redirects to https url [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139994071)
- operator should be able to use BBS client to verify that when an http route is mapped to an app, CC sends the router group guid with the routing payload [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141628549)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/capi-release #43: CAPI Failure when UAA Isn't Available on Internal Address Is Late and Obscure [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138211943)

#### [cc-uploader](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cc-uploader/tree/0788a7700ff651100a05ac94176c032e510956a0)
- CC-Uploader: uploading droplets and polling happens over an endpoint using mtls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139996781)

name: CAPI 1.24.0
body:
**Highlights**
- When not using the bridge, windows apps stage and run properly
- When not using the bridge, task and app syncing properly handles large numbers of tasks and apps

**CC API Version: 2.78.0 and [3.13.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.13.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### Known Issues

- Users that belong to any space containing a user provided service instance are unable to view any specific service plan: `/v2/service_plans/:guid`. Users are still able to view the marketplace and provision service instances.

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/2429003d3e89e72c066a56664fcc24d5e2f4c497)

- API client should NOT be able to run tasks that exceed org and space quotas [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141816433)
- API client should NOT see an error on the /v2/apps/:guid/stats endpoint when there are no running instances [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141430945)
- API client should follow a consistent schema to specify an *app-space relationship* when creating an app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141051241)
- API client should follow a consistent schema to specify an *package-to-app relationship* when creating a package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141054863)
- API client should see `checksum` key instead of `hash` key for bits package [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140515847)

- API client should see that expired packages are eventually removed from the db [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141506813)

- CC should include request ID in log messages from security_context middleware [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140969343)
- Improve error message when binding app to route in another space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138649897)
- Operator should NOT receive an error when using special characters in database passwords [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140095683)
- Operator should see that expired droplets and packages do NOT have hash values displayed when the blob has been deleted [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141797811)
- TasksSync and ProcessSync incorrectly fetches data from the CCDB when total number of entries exceeds the internal batch size [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/141737255)

#### Pull Requests and Issues

body: **Highlights** - Audit events added for organization creation, update, and delete **CC API Version: 2.76.0 and [3.11.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.11.0/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/9503da6c4dd59fd3b2503d517473a98b14a72768) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/3db08e602ef4f7156c681a8799bc53a2c6e65848) - 422 errors are easier to read [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139607915) - API client can discover the isolation segment resource location to help construct urls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140858973) - API client can discover the organization resource location to help construct urls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140861451) - API client can discover the space resource location to help construct urls [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140861305) - API client can get the default isolation segment relationship for an org [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139514895) - API client can get the isolation segment relationship for a space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139514885) - API client can unassign the default isolation segment for an organization in v2 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139316849) - App Developer can scale app while staging on V2 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137812701) - App developer should NOT see a vague message when stats are not available for stopped apps [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139506781) - As a CF Linux app operator, I expect the instance identity certificate to be associated with my CF app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140171589) - CC Clock does not log errors during enqueuing [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139564057) - I can toggle the new local diego sync with a feature flag separate from `temporary\_local\_{apps,tasks}` flags, so that users can start using bridge consumption [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139715405) - I want CF + Diego to keep the desired and actual apps in sync, so that a mismatch is automatically corrected [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139564797) - Investigate deadlock during buildpack deletion [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140431389) - Modify GET /v3/isolation_segments/:guid/relationships/organizations response [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139313573) - Modify GET /v3/isolation_segments/:guid/relationships/spaces response [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139313569) - Space developers should not be able to assign an iso seg to a space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140167917) - deleting an isolation segment with org associations returns a 422 error code [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139481131) - entitling an invalid organization returns a 422 error code [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139306855) - errors when removing entitlements are easy to understand and the logic around when i can remove an entitlement is simple [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139308221) - examples provided in tasks v3 require "Content-Type" [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138661279) - org entitlement should return a relationship response [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139315021) - remove link to space realtionship on iso seg b/c it doesn't return space resources [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139595713) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #784: specify certificate_properties on task and lrp definitions [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140435321) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #768: API Docs (v2) should have anchor links [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138668997) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #774: Add audit events for organizations [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139251113) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #775: cloud controller reject valid service_broker_url [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139258429) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng #778: Add user role events at space, org creation time [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/139839303) # Job Spec Changes - Cloud Controller Clock now requires SSL configuration with the following properties: - `cc.mutual_tls.ca_cert`: PEM-encoded CA certificate for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication - `cc.mutual_tls.public_cert`: PEM-encoded certificate for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication - `cc.mutual_tls.private_key`: PEM-encoded key for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication

name: CAPI 1.20.0
body:
**Highlights**
- This release removes the HA clock job locking, which was causing performance issues on CCDB.
- Introduce a scope to allow global auditing -- `cloud_controller.global_auditor`. This gives a readonly view of all resources, but exempts information that auditors do not need to see such as environment variables and credentials.

name: CAPI 1.16.0
body: **IMPORTANT** - This release requires the Nginx for Cloud Controller to have valid SSL configuration as part of requiring all internal communication within Cloud Foundry to use Mutual TLS. The Diego BBS and Cloud Controller should use a common CA. For existing deployments, use the Diego CA to generate a key and cert using `cloud-controller-ng.service.cf.internal` as the CN. The Diego CA and Cloud Controller Cert and Key should be configured per the job spec changes below. - This release contains a fix for the bulk query used by HM9K for those using the DEA Runtime. We recommend scaling HM9K to 0 instances, deploying this CAPI-Release, then scaling HM9K back to original number of instances. - This release changes how we've included the fog gem dependency. Previously, we included the entire fog gem and all providers. This release only includes supported fog providers listed below. If there's a provider that you need that is missing, let us know and we'll happily add it back. - fog-azure-rm - fog-aws - fog-local - fog-openstack - fog-google **CC API Version: [2.70.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/252/) and [3.5.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.5.0/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/36f4ae07a48fc30638603980717495445d241af4) - Bump to Ruby 2.3.3, Golang 1.7.4, Nginx 1.11.8 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133894135) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/52ba85ba88a441799159e965325efce85926faee) - API Client can list apps in alphabetical order [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136962495) - API client can specify an array of buildpacks for V3 App [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135544611) - API client can specify an array of buildpacks for V3 Droplet [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135883263) - Appears as though push and restage are using different memory calculations [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136590565) - As a CF operator, I expect all app instances, app tasks, and staging tasks to have reasonable container-wide PID limits [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135539841) - As an API user, I can List all Staging Security Groups for the Space [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129965411) - As an app developer, I would like my app to emit logs with a "hostname" to my syslog drains [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135750711) - BUILDPACK CACHE should use SHA-256 to ensure they have not been corrupted or tampered with [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/134745321) - BUILDPACKS should use SHA-256 to ensure they have not been corrupted or tampered with [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/134745463) - Expose app_domains property as a link [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138068873) - Expose system_domain property as a link [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138068861) - Operator does not observe increased error rate in New Relic due to HTTP 404 [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136079581) - Operator does not observe increased error rate in New Relic due to expired tokens [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136078605) - PACKAGES should use SHA-256 to ensure they have not been corrupted or tampered with [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/135519407) - Rate limiting blocks concurrent requests resulting in long request times for heavy users [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137814733) - Recursive app deletion with app bound to services that fail to unbind should fail gracefully [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136529479) - `system_domain_organization` should be defaulted to "system" [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/138068469) - deleting a security group or space that have a staging_security_group association fails [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137488853) - explicitly require fog metagems in our gemfile instead of fog [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136137075) - minimum staging memory is not configurable. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137563209) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/capi-release#42: Generalize running_in_container function [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137561781) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#669: CF list Application Security Group inconsistency [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128931633) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#753: Fail to list all Service Plans for a service broker using q=service_broker_guid%20IN%20 filter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136413879) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#756: /v2/organizations/GUID/summary returns no spaces when queried with cloud_controller.admin_read_only scope [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136979899) # Job Spec Changes - Cloud Controller now requires SSL configuration with the following properties: - `cc.mutual_tls.ca_cert`: PEM-encoded CA certificate for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication - `cc.mutual_tls.public_cert`: PEM-encoded certificate for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication - `cc.mutual_tls.private_key`: PEM-encoded key for secure, mutually authenticated TLS communication

name: CAPI 1.15.0
body: **IMPORTANT** - The `cloud_controller_clock` can now be deployed in an HA configuration. For users of cf-release manifest generation, this will happen in an upcoming version of cf-release. For users customizing their deployment manifest, we now recommend running the `cloud_controller_clock` job in 2 availability zones. These jobs can be on their own VM or colocated with other jobs. **CC API Version: [2.69.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/251) and [3.4.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.4.0/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.11](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/6f21ff2945d8fb3a0bfbcbb0a1bb1b74ca128bb2) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/c0be419caf3c4c0bd62253f0c3e70d905dd291b5) - Cloud Controller has a TLS server on the Internal Consul DNS hostname [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133894941) - Cloud Controller should set VCAP_APP_PORT environment variable to the same thing as PORT environment variable on Diego [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137142727) - Scaling an app on Diego while it is staging results in an Unknown Error [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/137132839) - DROPLETS should use SHA-256 to ensure they have not been corrupted or tampered with [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/134745107) - Make cloud_controller_clock HA [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136621261) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#754: find_error needs Ruby to be added to path [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/136453903) # Job Spec Changes - Valid `properties.uaa.sslPrivateKey`, `properties.uaa.sslCertificate`, and `properties.uaa.ca_cert` are now required for the CC to communicate with UAA via the internal HTTPS endpoint (normally to `uaa.service.cf.internal`). The [script in cf-release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-release/blob/master/scripts/generate-uaa-certs) can be used to generate a self-signed certificate, private key, and ca cert. - Added `cc.diego_sync.frequency_in_seconds`, the frequency with which we'll enqueue a job to ensure Diego is in sync. This synchronization is still experimental and is not used by default yet. Defaults to 30-seconds.

name: CAPI 1.14.0
body:
**IMPORTANT**
- This CAPI Release has several new manifest properties that aren’t meant to be required yet. We’ve discovered an issue with BOSH directors before v257 where these properties must still be set. One of the following workarounds should be applied:
  - Upgrade your BOSH deployment to v257 or later or
  - Set the following properties to `””` in your CF Deployment manifest: `cc.mutual_tls.ca_cert`, `cc.mutual_tls.public_cert`, and `cc.mutual_tls.private_key`

name: CAPI 1.11.0
body:
**CC API Version: [2.65.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/247) and [3.0.0](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.0.0/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/450c7911604ebbde2cc7264225b399c0cbd03e34)
- Bumped to Golang 1.7

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/058e366818aba86f8456662b0bba95b0e35846ab)
- As a Cloud Controller client, I would like to present a UAA token with `cloud_controller.user` scope to determine if the user has access to  sensitive information and/or insensitive information about an application [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133292043)
- Buildpacks should not be supplied to Diego if the blob doesn't exist [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131740345)
- Cloud Controller should protect against a broker that doesn't return credentials [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133604735)
- Add retry logic around FogBlob and DavBlob [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/124923231)
- Cloud controller should fail more gracefully when blobs are missing or the blobstore is misconfigured. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132878027)
- Add clearer documentation for seeding vs modifying/creating security groups [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133558645)
- All V3 Resources have an updated_at timestamp upon creation instead of null [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133067497)
- Admin read only cannot `curl /v2/spaces/:guid` [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132293563)
- Read-only admin users get unknown error when getting v2 apps [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133145457)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#699: Make service plans queryable by id provided by the service broker [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132760131)
- cloudfoundry/capi-release#34: Cloud Controller ctl script should not restart directly the consul_agent [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133681263)

name: CAPI 1.10.0
body: **IMPORTANT** - An issue was discovered in CAPI 1.9.0 where the increased communication to UAA via internal URL and HTTPS exposed the Cloud Controller to a [known segmentation fault in Ruby 2.3.1](https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/12292). This work has been reverted in CAPI 1.10.0. **CC API Version: [2.64.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/246/) and [3.0.0-alpha.6](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.0.0-alpha.6/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/6d348268ed9a60324fc3b72a51c177c4f010d55a) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/654e39c6d22f99e75ba0833236c5e6a3f12ad967) - V3 Alpha - As an App Developer, I would like to be able to specify the disk limit for a V3 task [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/133054601) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#685: Isolation segments <-> Organizations [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130958055) # Job Spec Changes - Job Spec Changes from CAPI 1.9.0 related to UAA SSL can remain but will be ignored by the Cloud Controller in this release

name: CAPI 1.9.0
body: **IMPORTANT** - Communication between Cloud Controller and UAA now defaults to using the UAA internal URL and HTTPS. This requires UAA to be configured with a valid SSLCertificate and SSLPrivateKey, and a corresponding CACert in the case of a self-signed certificate. See the [Job Spec Changes](#job-spec-changes) for more information. **CC API Version: [2.64.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/246/) and [3.0.0-alpha.5](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.0.0-alpha.5/)** **Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/303ba60a5f1b7c56cc9a6ce20a7129c3470507de) - As a CF operator, I expect that the CC-Bridge services' debug servers listen only on localhost by default [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/126667929) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/cadf27493cd72f123af9593c4b51bf61d66dbe51) - As an app developer, I expect staging tasks that run on Diego to allocate 4096 MB of disk instead of 6144 MB by default so that I am not consuming system resources unnecessarily [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/125960693) - As a CF operator, I would like my deploy to fail if buildpack blobstore is misconfigured [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/126811571) - As a CAPI client, I can remove a user from an org [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/111104042) - Creating a v2 app with a non-existent space causes an UnknownError [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132286737) - Root of API should include links to UAA server. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132632071) - Root of api.some-cloud-foundry.com/v3 should include link to apps [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132859531) - CC UAA interactions can be configured with a custom CA cert [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129982147) - As an app developer, I would like VCAP_APPLICATION to have cf api endpoint [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131833459) - Retrieving the roles of all Users in the Organization should be filterable by user guid [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/121258973) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#672: Last operation API invoked with stale broker credentials [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129486569) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#693: Always use the broker client [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131669559) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#697: Fix CLA link [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/132300517) # Job Spec Changes - Valid `properties.uaa.sslPrivateKey`, `properties.uaa.sslCertificate`, and `properties.uaa.ca_cert` are now required for the CC to communicate with UAA via the internal HTTPS endpoint (normally to `uaa.service.cf.internal`). The [script in cf-release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-release/blob/master/scripts/generate-uaa-certs) can be used to generate a self-signed certificate, private key, and ca cert. - CC-Bridge services' debug servers listen only on localhost by default. These components are typically deployed with Diego and no change is required if using defaults. If not using defaults, we recommend changing these properties to `127.0.0.1` and an available port number: `capi.cc_uploader.debug_addr`, `capi.nsync.listener_debug_addr`, `capi.nsync.bulker_debug_addr`, `capi.stager.debug_addr`, and `capi.tps.listener.debug_addr`. - `dea_next.staging_disk_limit_mb` now defaults to 4096, down from 6144, although there was a long standing bug where Cloud Controller would ignore this configuration and always use 4096. We don't expect this to amount to any required change for operators. This property affects the staging disk limit for both DEA and Diego and can now be changed to an operators desired amount of disk for application staging.

name: CAPI 1.8.0
body:
**IMPORTANT**
- This release fixes staging Python apps without a Procfile and apps using buildpacks that do not return a start command

**CC API Version: ~~2.63.0~~ and [3.0.0-alpha.4](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.0.0-alpha.4/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/c0e70a357b5cfa00c638da0ae66e0ec763743e2f)

name: CAPI 1.7.0
body:
**IMPORTANT**
- This release fixes a database migration that caused issues with certain app start commands.
- An issue was found staging Python buildpack based apps and apps using any buildpack that doesn't return process types in the staging result. We've prioritized this bug at the top of our backlog. Workaround is to add a Procfile containing any command, e.g. `web: foo`.

**CC API Version: [2.63.0](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/245/) and [3.0.0-alpha.3](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/3.0.0-alpha.3/)**

**Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)**

### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/c952006df4174249d91e296c799ab54361822477)

### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/1077b959f9472a5614f44739cdf130b16ca12a81)
- BUGFIX: apps that have double quotes in the start command break after the v3 migration is applied [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131588443)
- As an app developer, I should be able to upload a droplet for an app [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128036647)
- CloudController sets v3 App guid on DesiredAppMessage [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131324419)
- BUGFIX: v2 apps with environment variables starting with CF_ become invalid after deploying the v3 migration [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131334817)
- As a space developer, I expect Cloud Foundry / Diego to gracefully handle my app being stopped or deleted while an app is staging. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/117874165)
- Increase the width of the `dashboard_url` column in service instance table [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130320771)

#### Pull Requests and Issues
- cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#668: No error thrown when route path exceeds 128 characters [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128847443)

name: CAPI 1.6.0
body: **IMPORTANT** - An issue was found in the migration below that can affect application start commands. This release should not be used, a fix is being worked on for CAPI 1.7.0. **CC API Version: ~~2.63.0~~** **Service Broker API Version: [2.10](http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/services/api.html)** # CCDB Migration for V3 API This release includes a significant migration of the CCDB that is the first step to releasing the CC V3 API. **ALL EXPERIMENTAL V3 DATA WILL BE REMOVED WITH THIS MIGRATION** The migration will cause temporary API downtime as Cloud Controller jobs that have not been updated will not be able to use the migrated database schema. Users will not be able to use the CC API to push apps, update apps or get app information, but it will not affect apps currently deployed to Cloud Foundry. ## User Impact - Apps will continue to run normally. - The Cloud Controller API will be unavailable or raise errors during the deploy meaning users will be unable to push apps, update existing apps or get app information. - Crashing apps will not be restarted while the Cloud Controllers are being deployed. - App logs will not be aggregated to syslog drains while the Cloud Controllers are being deployed if the deployment takes longer than the “[properties.syslog_drain_binder.drain_url_ttl_seconds](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/loggregator/blob/develop/jobs/syslog_drain_binder/spec#L43-L45)” manifest property. The default value for this property is 60 seconds. ## Operator Procedure Operators are not required to do anything differently for this deploy, but due to the size of the migration, operators may wish to take some additional steps to minimize user facing errors. See the Deployment Options below for information on steps an operator may take for this deployment. 1. Ensure there is a current CCDB backup prior to deploying. 2. Ensure there is adequate disk space available on the database server. This migration moves around significant amounts of data in the CCDB. The amount of disk space required will vary by RDBMS, it is recommended to err on the safe side. 3. Alert consumers of the API that there is a maintenance period, specifically any GUI client may want to display a maintenance page. 4. Consider temporarily increasing the value of “properties.syslog_drain_binder.drain_url_ttl_seconds” to prevent app logs failing to propagate to syslog drains during the deploy. 5. Select a deployment method from below and deploy. ## Deployment Options ### Deploy Normally This is the simplest option. It should result in the shortest downtime period, but may be the most surprising to users as requests will appear to fail randomly as a result of a rolling deploy. #### Procedure 1. Deploy the updated cf-release #### Impact - Users and clients will receive 500 errors from the API. - Cloud Foundry components continue to attempt to access the database resulting in errors until the deploy is completed. ### Scale API jobs to zero instances This option prevents access to CCDB by Cloud Foundry components that do not know the updated schema. It also prevents clients from seeing seemingly random errors; they will only see unavailability errors. #### Procedure 1. Prior to deploying the new cf-release, perform a manifest only deploy that scales down the following jobs - api_z(x) - api_worker_z(x) - clock_global 2. Deploy the updated cf-release with the original scale of the above jobs #### Impact - Cloud Foundry components will not attempt to access CCDB until they are able to complete requests. - Users and clients will get 404 errors instead of 500 errors - Requests will begin completing successfully when the first instances of the API server come up part way through the deploy - VMs will need to be created during the deploy which may be slow in some environments ### Stop the API jobs This option prevents access to CCDB by Cloud Foundry components that do not know the updated schema. It also prevents clients from seeing seemingly random errors; they will only see unavailability errors. #### Procedure 1. Prior to deploying the new cf-release, perform a `bosh stop` command on the following jobs. - api_z(x) - api_worker_z(x) - clock_global 2. Deploy the updated cf-release 3. Perform a `bosh start` command on the jobs that were previously stopped. #### Impact - Cloud Foundry components will not attempt to access CCDB until they are able to complete requests. - Users and clients will get 404 errors instead of 500 errors - API requests will not be served until the entire deploy has completed and the API servers have been started. This will create a larger maintenance window than the option to scale down instances. ## Failing Deployment Procedure In the event of a failing deployment related to this migration, operators will have to deploy the previously deployed version of CF Release and restore a CCDB backup. Other components using the database will need to be backed up and restored to roll back to a previously deployed CF release version. ## Important Notes - V3 Service Bindings should be deleted before deploy as the V3 Service Bindings will be deleted without calling out to the broker. - V2 Apps keep an extra droplet when changing to the most recent droplet. The database record for this droplet will be removed during the migration. We intend to write a [background clean up job to remove orphaned blobs from the blobstore](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131456519) in the near future. - V2 Apps can no longer be moved between spaces. - V2 Apps can no longer be changed from buildpack to docker and vice versa. - V2 App usage events recently got "previous" entries for several fields. It is no longer possible to determine `previous_package_state` so this field has been deprecated. - V2 Apps running on Diego will now be tagged `APP/PROC/WEB/n` (where n is the instance number) in application logs sent to syslog drains. - V2 Apps that are staging during this deploy will likely fail without updating the app. The app should simply be restaged as it will be stuck in the `PENDING` package state. - V2 Apps using environment variables beginning with `CF_` will be in a bad state after the migration. We plan on [releasing a quick follow to fix this](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/131334817). # Job Spec Changes - `pending_packages.expiration_in_seconds` has been removed. pending packages will now be expired 5 minutes after the staging timeout. - `pending_packages.frequency_in_seconds` has been renamed to `pending_droplets.frequency_in_seconds`. - `capi.tps.traffic_controller_url` now [defaults to the internal traffic controller url](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129670351) instead of being dynamically configured to reach the traffic controller through the gorouter. Feel free to remove this from whatever deployment contains TPS (normally Diego deployment). There is an [upcoming story to do this automatically for those using the Diego manifest generation scripts](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130134865). ### [CAPI Release](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/capi-release/tree/bd026a9b3c2b6d19d9a794c11cb07a5d7c05ea6e) - Jobs in CAPI release should use internal URL for traffic controller [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129670351) ### [stager](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/stager/tree/ed7537d7f0dd4456a4fef2a2e5afb9ca36b47649) - As a BBS API client, I would like to observe that my LRP instances are not running or my Tasks have failed because there are no cells available matching those placement tags [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/129370089) ### [Cloud Controller](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng/tree/5cfb5dac42c080d34420191c2ec04bfc765799e0) - CVE-2016-6658: As a CF operator, I expect buildpack urls to be stored and displayed with obfuscated credentials for Audit Events and App Usage Events. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130114809) - CVE-2016-6658: As a CF operator, I expect buildpacks in droplet results to be obfuscated [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130043847) - service_plan_guid shouldn't be null in /v2/spaces/:space_guid/service_instances when service plan is private / inactive [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/119333093) - As a CF operator, I expect to see the CC nginx access and error logs in my syslog data [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/79114924) - Specifying a buildpack for an app can lead to not being able to GET /v2/apps [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130119383) - packages and droplets should be removed from the blobstore when they are expired [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127118541) - cc could return a better error when the blobstore is unavailable/misconfigured [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/116333577) - V3 Alpha - V3 links should include protocol and host [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/117960069) - As an API user, I would like to list tasks by app with filter for sequence_id [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130881685) - As an app developer, I want tasks for an app to be numbered sequentially [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130589445) - Root of api.some-cloud-foundry.com/v3 should return JSON representation of all resources available in the V3 API. [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130761643) - List tasks for an app optionally shows command and environment_variables [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130691973) - Get a task optionally shows command and environment variables [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130692271) - List tasks never shows command or environment variables [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130670325) - As an app developer, I want tasks for an app to generate their own names if not provided [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130777189) - Root of api.some-cloud-foundry.com should return JSON representation of all APIs available on the Cloud Foundry deployment [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/124203091) #### Pull Requests and Issues - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#654: handle_local_blobstore.sh cannot create directories [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127166653) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#659: List all Spaces for the Space Quota Definition has unexplained space_guid parameter [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127836109) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#663: V3 API cannot delete droplet that has been used for running tasks [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128152745) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#677: Fix to make validate_add_shared_organization being called [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130082501) - cloudfoundry/cloud_controller_ng#679: scripts/which_cf.sh uses CF_RELEASE_DIR environment variable in more places [details](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/130245817)
